pullRequest.title: add docs for TaskCountStatsMonitor
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description



Add docs for org.apache.druid.server.metrics.TaskCountStatsMonitor. This is useful for users to monitor task status.





This PR has:

 been self-reviewed.
 been tested in a test Druid cluster.

nodes.bodyText: As someone new to the monitors, I think explaining why you would need this is helpful. Are there specific use cases where I should be monitoring the task counts? Maybe I want to set up alerting on failed jobs?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -353,6 +353,7 @@ The following monitors are available:
 |`org.apache.druid.segment.realtime.RealtimeMetricsMonitor`|Reports statistics on Realtime processes.|
 |`org.apache.druid.server.metrics.EventReceiverFirehoseMonitor`|Reports how many events have been queued in the EventReceiverFirehose.|
 |`org.apache.druid.server.metrics.QueryCountStatsMonitor`|Reports how many queries have been successful/failed/interrupted.|
+|`org.apache.druid.server.metrics.TaskCountStatsMonitor`|Reports how many tasks are success/failed/running/pending/waiting.|

nodes.bodyText: Suggest ... tasks are success ... -> ... tasks have been succeeded ...

 |`org.apache.druid.server.metrics.QueryCountStatsMonitor`|Reports how many queries have been successful/failed/interrupted.|
+|`org.apache.druid.server.metrics.TaskCountStatsMonitor`|Reports how many tasks are success/failed/running/pending/waiting.|

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            |`org.apache.druid.server.metrics.QueryCountStatsMonitor`|Reports how many queries have been successful/failed/interrupted.|
          
          
            
            |`org.apache.druid.server.metrics.QueryCountStatsMonitor`|Reports how many queries have succeeded, failed, or were interrupted.|
